subject: [ANN] EMMA: a free and fast code coverage tool
msgSnippet: EMMA (http://emma.sourceforge.net) is a Java code coverage tool based on bytecode instrumentation. Whilst not the only tool on the market right now, EMMA

EMMA (http://emma.sourceforge.net) is a Java code 
coverage tool based on bytecode instrumentation. Whilst not the only 
tool on the market right now, EMMA strives to be different by being 
very lightweight, flexible, and fast.

In fact, speed is one of EMMA's signature features. Besides using a 
fast bytecode processor (~2ms/class), EMMA can do instrumentation 
incrementally or even "on-the-fly", without a special preparation 
phase.

EMMA's mission is to move code coverage from an infrequent release 
gate (possibly run on a dedicated "coverage" machine because the 
license is too expensive for the entire team) to the domain of agile 
testing and development ("check coverage while still writing 
testcases and *before* you check code in"). Coupled with a very 
liberal license, EMMA is a tool that provides code coverage stats as 
an easy side effect of unit testing itself.

EMMA is free/open source and at the same time coded from a commercial 
software developer's point of view: it works in any (not just the 
latest and greatest beta from Sun) Java 2 runtime and scales to very 
large projects (the largest single instrumentation run so far covered 
20000+ classes). It has no external dependencies and is not tied to 
any particular testing framework.

EMMA home page: http://emma.sourceforge.net
EMMA SourceForge project page: http://sourceforge.net/projects/emma/
